intro: Chrysocoryne tridens, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that resemble small bells. The plant has elliptical, dark green leaves and produces a milky sap that is toxic. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Chrysocoryne tridens is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
